title: Who wrote the most Queen songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m going to answer this comprehensively: studio album by studio album and track by track. Bonus tracks recorded during album sessions are italicized. Via Wikipedia: QUEEN:Keep Yourself Alive (Brian May)Doing All Right (May, Tim Staffell)Great King Rat (Freddie Mercury)My Fairy King (Mercury)Liar (Mercury)The Night Comes Down (May)Modern Times Rock ’n’ Roll (Roger Taylor)Son and Daughter (May)Jesus (Mercury)Seven Seas of Rhye (Mercury)ALBUM SCORE: Mercury 5, May 4, Taylor 1 QUEEN II:Procession (May)Father to Son (May)White Queen (As It Began) (May)Some Day One Day (May)The Loser in the End (Taylor)Ogre Battle (Mercury)The Fairy Feller's Master-Stroke (Mercury)Nevermore (Mercury)The March of the Black Queen (Mercury)Funny How Love Is (Mercury)Seven Seas of Rhye (Mercury)See What a Fool I’ve Been (May)ALBUM SCORE: Mercury 6, May 5, Taylor 1 SHEER HEART ATTACK:Brighton Rock (May)Killer Queen (Mercury)Tenement Funster (Taylor)Flick of the Wrist (Mercury)Lily of the Valley (Mercury)Now I’m Here (May)In the Lap of the Gods (Mercury)Stone Cold Crazy (John Deacon, May, Mercury, Taylor)Dear Friends (May)Misfire (Deacon)Bring Back That Leroy Brown (Mercury)She Makes Me (Stormtrooper in Stilettos) (May)In the Lap of the Gods…Revisited (Mercury)ALBUM SCORE: Mercury 7, May 5, Taylor 2, Deacon 2 A NIGHT AT THE OPERA:Death on Two Legs (Dedicated to…) (Mercury)Lazing on a Sunday Afternoon (Mercury)I’m in Love with My Car (Taylor)You’re My Best Friend (Deacon)’39 (May)Sweet Lady (May)Seaside Rendezvous (Mercury)The Prophet’s Song (May)Love of My Life (Mercury)Good Company (May)Bohemian Rhapsody (Mercury)God Save the Queen (Traditional, arr. May)ALBUM SCORE: Mercury 5, May 4, Taylor 1, Deacon 1 A DAY AT THE RACES:Tie Your Mother Down (May)You Take My Breath Away (Mercury)Long Away (May)The Millionaire Waltz (Mercury)You and I (Deacon)Somebody to Love (Mercury)White Man (May)Good Old-Fashioned Lover Boy (Mercury)Drowse (Taylor)Teo Torriate (Let Us Cling Together) (May)ALBUM SCORE: Mercury 4, May 4, Taylor 1, Deacon 1 NEWS OF THE WORLD:We Will Rock You (May)We Are the Champions (Mercury)Sheer Heart Attack (Taylor)All Dead, All Dead (May)Spread Your Wings (Deacon)Fight from the Inside (Taylor)Get Down, Make Love (Mercury)Sleeping on the Sidewalk (May)Who Needs You (Deacon)It’s Late (May)My Melancholy Blues (Mercury)ALBUM SCORE: May 4, Mercury 3, Taylor 2, Deacon 2 JAZZ:Mustapha (Mercury)Fat Bottomed Girls (May)Jealousy (Mercury)Bicycle Race (Mercury)If You Can’t Beat Them (Deacon)Let Me Entertain You (Mercury)Dead on Time (May)In Only Seven Days (Deacon)Dreamer’s Ball (May)Fun It (Taylor)Leaving Home Ain’t Easy (May)Don’t Stop Me Now (Mercury)More of That Jazz (Taylor)ALBUM SCORE: Mercury 5, May 4, Taylor 2, Deacon 2 THE GAME:Play the Game (Mercury)Dragon Attack (May)Another One Bites the Dust (Deacon)Need Your Loving Tonight (Deacon)Crazy Little Thing Called Love (Mercury)Rock It (Prime Jive) (Taylor)Don’t Try Suicide (Mercury)Sail Away Sweet Sister (May)Coming Soon (Taylor)Save Me (May)ALBUM SCORE: Mercury 3, May 3, Taylor 2, Deacon 2 FLASH GORDON:Flash’s Theme (May)In the Space Capsule (The Love Theme) (Taylor)Ming’s Theme (In the Court of Ming the Merciless) (Mercury)The Ring (Hypnotic Seduction of Dale) (Mercury)Football Fight (Mercury)In the Death Cell (Love Theme Reprise) (Taylor)Execution of Flash (Deacon)The Kiss (Aura Resurrects Flash) (Mercury, Howard Blake)Arboria (Planet of the Tree Men) (Deacon)Escape from the Swamp (Taylor)Flash to the Rescue (May)Vultan’s Theme (Attack of the Hawk Men) (Mercury)Battle Theme (May)The Wedding March (Instrumental) (Richard Wagner, arr. May)Marriage of Dale and Ming (And Flash Approaching) (May, Taylor)Crash Dive on Mingo City (May)Flash’s Theme Reprise (Victory Celebrations) (May)The Hero (May, Blake)ALBUM SCORE: May 7, Mercury 5, Taylor 4, Deacon 2 HOT SPACE:Staying Power (Mercury)Dancer (May)Back Chat (Deacon)Body Language (Mercury)Action This Day (Taylor)Put Out the Fire (May)Life is Real (Song for Lennon) (Mercury)Calling All Girls (Taylor)Las Palabras de Amor (The Words of Love) (May)Cool Cat (Mercury, Deacon)Under Pressure (Deacon, May, Mercury, Taylor, David Bowie)ALBUM SCORE: Mercury 5, May 4, Taylor 3, Deacon 3 THE WORKS:Radio Ga-Ga (Taylor)Tear it Up (May)It’s a Hard Life (Mercury)Man on the Prowl (Mercury)Machines (Or “Back to Humans”) (May, Taylor)I Want to Break Free (Deacon)Keep Passing the Open Windows (Mercury)Hammer to Fall (May)Is This the World We Created…? (Mercury, May)I Go Crazy (May)Thank God It’s Christmas (May, Taylor)ALBUM SCORE: May 6, Mercury 4, Taylor 3, Deacon 1 A KIND OF MAGIC:One Vision (Taylor)A Kind of Magic (Taylor)One Year of Love (Deacon)Pain is So Close to Pleasure (Mercury, Deacon)Friends Will Be Friends (Mercury, Deacon)Who Wants to Live Forever (May)Gimme the Prize (Kurgan’s Theme) (May)Don’t Lose Your Head (Taylor)Princes of the Universe (Mercury)ALBUM SCORE: Mercury 3, Taylor 3, Deacon 3, May 2 (a bit low for him!) THE MIRACLE:Party (Mercury, May, Deacon)Khashoggi’s Ship (Deacon, May, Mercury, Taylor)The Miracle (Mercury, Deacon)I Want it All (May)The Invisible Man (Taylor)Breakthru (Mercury, Taylor)Rain Must Fall (Mercury, Deacon)Scandal (May)My Baby Does Me (Mercury, Deacon)Was it All Worth It? (Mercury)Hang On in There (Deacon, May, Mercury, Taylor)Chinese Torture (May)Hijack My Heart (Taylor)Stealin’ (Mercury)ALBUM SCORE: Mercury 9, May 6, Deacon 6, Taylor 5 INNUENDO:Innuendo (Mercury, Taylor)I’m Going Slightly Mad (Mercury, Peter Straker)Headlong (May)I Can’t Live With You (May)Don’t Try So Hard (Mercury)Ride the Wild Wind (Taylor)All God’s People (Mercury, Mike Moran)These Are the Days of Our Lives (Taylor)Delilah (Mercury)The Hitman (Mercury, May, Deacon)Bijou (Mercury, May)The Show Must Go On (May)Lost Opportunity (May)ALBUM SCORE: Mercury 7, May 6, Taylor 3, Deacon 1 MADE IN HEAVEN was a collaborative effort, pieced together after Freddie’s death. CUMULATIVE SCORE:Freddie Mercury: 71Brian May: 64Roger Taylor: 33John Deacon: 26 TL;DR version? It was Freddie!

All 4 wrote songs, but the majority of charting tracks on the albums were penned by Freddie and Brian. On the earlier albums you could generally tell a Roger Taylor song by the fact he usually sang on them. Freddie songs were generally more extravagant with touches of opera and anthem like. Brian wrote more of the heavier stuff and Deacon liked to funk it up a little, having his most success with Another one bites the dust. The band credited all 4 members equally with songwriting from A kind of magic onward.
